basics.name: Matias Rios
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: +4 years of experience as a software engineer. I drive business success through visionary leadership and an entrepreneurial mindset.
basics.about:
In 2013, I pursued a degree in computer engineering, and by 2018, I had sold my first software: an inventory app for a local pet shop. Since then, I've being coding for diverse industries, including building, ecommerce, physical retail, healthcare, distribution, port logistics, and corporate transportation.

My experience spans from frontend hybrid mobile development to pure backend engineering. My main focus these days is on backend development, excelling in the planning phase with strategic and foresighted solutions. Notable projects include leading a mobile app's journey from beta to app stores at Nuqlea, and implementing a key integration process at Kalkomey, driving increased subscriptions and revenue.

When I'm not at the computer, I’m usually at the gym, playing soccer at the best friend's club of my city, or with friends and family. I also manage projects at Geome7ric, my software venture.

work.name: Kalkomey
work.summary: Backend lead at HuntWise, a hunting app. Collaborated closely with product directors, marketing, mobile, and web teams, providing crucial support to enhance HuntWise's market positioning. Recognized with a promotion for effective leadership and contributions to the team.

work.name: Geome7ric
work.summary: These days, my primary role is guiding discoveries and development. Specializing in bespoke applications using Quasar Framework and NestJS. Focused on modern, tailored applications for diverse clientele.

work.name: RazorTech
work.summary: In charge of the backend development in Ruby on Rails, consistently met project milestones for Cargill, a key client, and seized opportunities to expand our services internationally, resulting in mutual benefits.

work.name: Nuqlea
work.summary: Led mobile app development, contributed to platform design using Quasar Framework, Laravel. Transitioned app from beta to production on Apple, Google. Enhanced B2C app, tackled system-wide issues, improved UX/UI. Learned startup agility, meeting deadlines.

footer: Based on the design of Brittany Chiang, this SPA is built with the Quasar Framework and deployed with Vercel. All text is set in the Inter typeface.
